definition: yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
thin/to lose weight/(of clothing) tight/(of meat) lean/(of land) unproductive

sentences.english: The poor little girl is sallow and emaciated.
sentences.chinese: 那可怜的小女孩面黄肌瘦。

sentences.english: Her illness has left her thin and pale.
sentences.chinese: 疾病把她折磨得面黄肌瘦。

sentences.english: Sallow and emaciated, firm flower plait, but is very confused, the facial expression be diffused.
sentences.chinese: 面黄肌瘦，扎着花辫，却甚是零乱，表情苍茫。

sentences.english: When he did come he looked sick and bad.
sentences.chinese: 当他回来后，他看上去面黄肌瘦。

definition: to be all skin and bones (idiom)/also written 皮包骨[pi2 bao1 gu3]
messy hair and dirty face/bad appearance
lit. clothes not covering the body (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
looking or feeling sickly/weak and dispirited through illness
lit. food not filling the stomach (idiom)/fig. poverty-stricken
